channel.title: Human Judgment on Computational Uncertainty Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Human Judgment on Computational Uncertainty Lab

item.title: Early human judgment forecasts of human monkeypox, May 2022
item.description: These results suggest that a human judgment forecasting platform can quickly generate probabilistic predictions for targets of public health importance

item.title: Aggregating Human Judgment Probabilistic Predictions of Coronavirus Disease 2019 Transmission, Burden, and Preventive Measures
item.description: Our work shows that aggregated human judgment forecasts for infectious agents are timely, accurate, and adaptable, and can be used as a tool to aid public health decision making during outbreaks.

item.title: Aggregating probabilistic predictions of the safety, efficacy, and timing of a COVID-19 vaccine
item.description: To support public health decision making, we solicited trained forecasters and experts in vaccinology and infectious disease to provide monthly probabilistic predictions from July to September of 2020 of the efficacy, safety, timing, and delivery of a COVID-19 vaccine.
